data.title: Air Charter Expo
data.text:
About AIR SUPPORT A/S:

Today we support 500+ aviation operators worldwide with flight planning and tracking software solutions.

AIR SUPPORT is a private software company founded in 1989. Our headquarters are located at Billund Airport, with our Research and Development department in Odense, Denmark. Though the company originates from Denmark, we also have regional representatives in France and USA.

AIR SUPPORT is best known for:

PPS Flight Planning

CrewBriefing App

OpsControl | Flight Watch | Weather Watch

Postflight data and statistics

24/7 customer support – best in class customer support and offering integration with more than 50 scheduling-, EFB- and maintenance systems, etc.

In fact, AIR SUPPORT provides software solutions in more than 90 countries globally. “PPS” is the preferred flight planning provider within European Regional Airlines (ERA).

This is what our users say about our software:

“We spend less time on the flight planning process and minimize the risk of making mistakes in procedures. “

“PPS is a very intuitive planning tool.”

“With the cost-optimization tool, we do not only save time but also money in the planning process.”

“We experience significant improvements in the production speed.”

“PPS is a user-friendly system that easily integrates with many of our existing systems.”

“We have unlimited access to databases and user-defined settings.”

“After the pandemic, we were surprised that the price continued to be low” and that the development of the system continues now even at a higher pace.

Innovation Strategy

Annually AIR SUPPORT invests more than 22% of the company’s turnover in research and development for preparing tomorrows solutions to the standard and requirements of flight operations world wide.

Our motto continues to be FLEXIBILITY MAKES THE DIFFERENCE!

For more information: AIR SUPPORT. Category: Ops Software, Flight Support Expo location: 166

We as Global Airlift Solutions own the first EASA certified cargo version of the PC12 - The Pilatus PC-12NG – Executive Freighter!

In order to use the full performance capabilities of the PC-12NG Executive Freighter we worked closely with our AOC Holder Fly7 Finland. We are approved to fly within the ICAO Europe & Middle East Region as well as North Africa. For flights to and from the UK we hold Block Permits and can operate 24/7/365. In order to operate cargo flights into the EU originating from non-EU countries, we are ACC3 validated and as well ICS2 compliant for all air cargo & Airmail shipments.

We are a Dangerous Goods approved carrier and our license includes Class 1, Explosives and Class 7 Radioactives. In fact, we hold the Radioactive License for Luxembourg and Romania, we are registered for the Netherlands and France and have a valid DGR Liscense for Serbia. Last but not least we have a valid EU Type 2 license for the transport of live animals.

Our Pilatus PC=12NG executive cargo fleet is good to go for special missions where additional cargo attendants, a courier or technicians/mechanics might be needed. Our aircraft are always equipped with one passenger seat and a second one can be installed on request. The Pilatus PC-12NG Executive Freighter is the Swiss Army Knife of the sky; faster, greener and more flexible than any other cargo aircraft or light jet in its class.

For more information: Global Airlift Solutions. Category: Charter Expo location: Inside static

Originally founded as Distribution Tractor Services in 1998, Terberg DTS (UK) Ltd is a UK subsidiary of the Royal Terberg Group. It is the market leading supplier of specialist vehicles, equipment and support to the UK logistics, distribution, port, industrial, aviation, fire and rescue, road and rail applications.

Terberg DTS provides a comprehensive offering of new and used Terberg tractors, Aviation GSE and Fire and Rescue vehicle and equipment for both sale and hire. Operating from premises at Halifax and Gloucester, with a network of highly skilled field and workshop based engineers and a substantial parts holding, allows Terberg DTS to support customers with nationwide breakdown cover 24 hours a day / 365 days a year. This ensures maximum uptime and an outstanding first time fix rate.

With an experienced and knowledgeable sales team, close working relationship with the Terberg factory and links with third party suppliers around the world, Terberg DTS is able to offer a solution for all applications ranging from specialist build vehicles through to organisational fleets. These partnerships coupled with Terberg DTS’s expertise and renowned service and support capability extends well beyond the Logistics and Seaport sectors into both the civilian and military aircraft handling and fire and rescue areas.

For more information: Terberg DTS Aviation Division. Category: Ground Equipment Expo location: 155

VOO is the next-generation B2B marketplace for charter brokers and aircraft operators enabling instant business jet bookings. The platform uses integrations and utilizes advanced automation to simplify the entire charter booking lifecycle, from accurate charter price calculations based on real-time aircraft availability to seamless booking and payment processing.

VOO revolutionizes the charter booking process by providing offering auto-calculated charter prices, transforming requests into confirmed bookings and enabling direct as well as instant booking, accelerating the whole workflow and enhancing overall efficiency. VOO empowers industry professionals to close deals fast and effortlessly, fostering a dynamic network within the business aviation landscape.

VOO automatically calculates comprehensive pricing as if an experienced charter sales manager would have done it, encompassing a broad range of factors, including aircraft and airport pricing and associated costs, such as luxury taxes and VAT. The platform also considers logistics as well as available discounts on paid but not yet executed positioning flights, aligning with settings defined by the operator.

VOO is built on a cutting-edge technological stack that ensures optimal performance, security and scalability. Leveraging state-of-the-art web technologies and adhering to stringent coding standards, VOO was developed as a robust platform capable of handling the demands of business aviation professionals and meeting the highest industry standards.

Brokers benefit from enhanced search parameters, delivering more precise flight options. Operators gain control over their appearance and offerings by configuring their setup and pricing and can confidently offer competitive and profitable charter prices without compromising their charter rates or sales strategy. VOO’s innovative approach optimizes the charter experience, saving time, reducing errors, and building trust between brokers and operators.

For more information: VOO flights. Category: Online Booking Platforms Expo location: 81
